item.title: Tunisia PM sacked after violent Covid protests
item.description: Protesters clashed with police as they demanded the government be dismissed over Covid failings.

item.title: Triathlon gold goes to Norway at Tokyo 2020
item.description: Great Britain's Alex Yee wins silver in a punishing men's triathlon at the Tokyo Olympics as Kristian Blummenfelt of Norway claims gold.

item.title: Covid: Fauci says US heading in wrong direction as cases rise
item.description: President Joe Biden's top medical adviser says cases are rising in areas with low vaccination rates.

item.title: Climate change: Israel to cut 85% of emissions by mid-century
item.description: PM Naftali Bennett says the decision will help the country gradually shift to a low-carbon economy.

item.title: Afghanistan curfew imposed as Taliban militants advance
item.description: The government says the measure is to help its forces stop Taliban militants infiltrating cities.

item.title: Deadly street protests over Iran water shortages
item.description: Khuzestan is one of the country's hottest regions, where temperatures can reach 50C.

item.title: Jackie Mason, rabbi turned comedian, dies aged 93
item.description: The famed US stand-up comedian and actor voiced Krusty the Clown's father in The Simpsons.

item.title: Meteor wows Norway after blazing through night sky
item.description: The meteor is believed to have landed in a forest after flashes of light were seen across Norway.

item.title: Australia Covid: Anti-lockdown protesters condemned
item.description: It comes after thousands marched through Australian cities to demand an end to lockdown measures.

item.title: Rockslide destroys bridge in northern India
item.description: It was one of several landslides in Himachal Pradesh on Sunday.

item.title: Typhoon sweeps into eastern China after flooding chaos
item.description: A major storm makes landfall in the city of Zhoushan, days after floods devastated central areas.

item.title: Nigeria school kidnappers abduct man delivering ransom
item.description: Criminals kidnap an elderly man who was sent to pay a ransom for the release of 136 school children.

item.title: Unesco adds Madrid's Paseo del Prado and Retiro Park to heritage list
item.description: The famous Paseo del Prado and Retiro Park are symbols of the Spanish capital's history.

item.title: Nigerian outrage at brazen bandit attacks
item.description: The shooting down of a military jet shows how organised crime is becoming more daring by the day.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: One athlete braved sharks and crocodiles
item.description: Training for the Olympics can be a full-time job but Jo Brigden-Jones has combined it with much more.

item.title: Covid-19: Recent claims about cremations and vaccines fact-checked
item.description: Debunking claims shared widely on social media about cremations in the UK and US vaccine statistics.

item.title: Excitement over wooden shipwreck found in Antigua's seabed
item.description: Historians believe the wreck found in Antigua to be the 1762 Beaumont, a French merchant ship.

item.title: Afrobeats in Japan: British-Nigerian hip hop dancer teaching children how to dance
item.description: Yinka Oshiletu, a British-Nigerian hip hop dancer is bringing Afrobeats sounds to Japan's young dancers.

item.title: Wildfires spread from California to Nevada
item.description: Fire crews are battling extreme temperatures to control wildfires in California and Nevada.

item.title: ICYMI: World's deepest pool and a royal ritual resumes
item.description: Here's a round-up of the week's news you might have missed.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: The youngest athletes, past and present
item.description: GB skateboarder Sky Brown is 13 years old, but there have been even younger in the history of the Games.

item.title: Tips from the Netherlands on how to build a nation of cyclists
item.description: Some tips from the Dutch Cycling Embassy on how to make bikes the easiest and safest way to travel.

item.title: Golds, shock exits and heat on day one
item.description: There were early gold medals for China, Iran and South Korea on a sweltering opening day of the Tokyo Olympic Games.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Day-by-day guide to the key events, big stars and British medal hopes
item.description: Want to know what's happening when in Tokyo? Check out our comprehensive guide to all the action in Japan.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Is the USA 'Dream Team' era coming to an end?
item.description: Team USA's men's and women's basketball teams have had difficult preparations for the Olympics, so could Tokyo 2020 see an end to their domination?

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: US gymnast Simone Biles gets her own goat emoji
item.description: What started as a light-hearted response to her "haters" is now an official Simone Biles emoji.

item.title: John Coates: Australian Olympic boss in awkward 'mansplaining' row
item.description: In an awkward exchange, John Coates ordered politician Annastacia Palaszczuk to attend the Olympics.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Ten global stars to watch out for at the Games
item.description: From Simone Biles to Bruce Springsteenâ€™s daughter Jessica - who are the athletes to follow at the Tokyo Olympics?

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Japanese artists reimagine countries as anime samurai
item.description: The creators have used the flags of competing nations as inspiration to design Japanese warriors.

item.title: 2032 Games: Brisbane confirmed as Olympic and Paralympic host
item.description: Brisbane is confirmed as the host of the 2032 Olympic and Paralympic Games after approval at an IOC meeting in Tokyo
